intro: Eriocaulon fergusonii, commonly known as the Ferguson's bulbous rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering stems bear tiny white or pale green flowers, which are clustered in dense spikes. Eriocaulon fergusonii is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
